subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla. — There are 41 players left in the Mets’ major league camp, meaning that General Manager Omar Minaya must bid adieu to 16 by Sunday to complete the opening day roster. Most of the decisions will not be fulfilled until Friday, when the team leaves Florida, but the lucky 25 who will be introduced Monday at Dolphin Stadium are slowly but surely taking shape.
